page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: There is a great variation in land use here. Garthamlock, Ruchazie and Craigend are densly packed council housing schemes with few amenities. Millerston is mainly private housing. To the disbelief of local teenagers, the foundations of private houses have been laid between Craigend and Garthamlock in place of council houses demolished a few years ago. The schemes enclose a stretch of wetland, unused moorland and rough grazing. The main local industry,{Cardowan {Colliery,}closed in 1983, increasing unemployment and leaving further waste land. This leaves only the{Black and {White whisky}bottling plant in Stepps to provide local work. Round the housing schemes lie farm land and{Hogganfield Park,}which has a loch and bird sanctuary. This provides some contrast for those living here.
